org.quackbot
Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  org.quackbot.Controller

public class Controller
extends Object

Quackbot is an advanced IRC bot framework based off of PircBot.

At the core, its a ready made IRC bot that does everything a normal bot should: Support for connection to multiple servers, Proper multithreading, abstraction of commands, hooks into any part of execution, and persistence by database

This is the main class of Quackbot, configuring and managing everything. There should only be ONE instance, which is accessable with #instance.

If this is being used in a larger project, it is highly recommended to start this in its own thread

A minimal setup should look like this:
Controller ctrl = new Controller(); //Initalize ctrl.connectDB("databasename", 10, "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver", "jdbc:mysql://url.com/databasename", null, null, "username", "password"); //connect to database ctrl.start(); //Execute Quackbot
All of those calls are absolutely nessesary. Leaving out connectDB will yield a QuackbotException, leaving out start will just not do anything

Other methods of intrest include #addCommand(Quackbot.PluginLoader), addPrefix(java.lang.String), addServer(java.lang.String, int, java.lang.String[]), and #initHooks

Please read documentation for more explination

Author:
Leon Blakey

Constructor Detail

Controller

public Controller()
Init for Quackbot. Sets instance, adds shutdown hook, and starts GUI if requested

Parameters:
makeGui - Show the GUI or not. WARNING: If there is no GUI, a slf4j Logging implementation must be provided to get any output

start

public void start()
Executes Quackbot. Loads commands, starts service commands, connects to servers. If this isn't called, then the bot does nothing

addServer

@Transactional
public void addServer(String address,
                                    int port,
                                    String... channels)
Creates a new server, adds to database, and connects

Parameters:
address - Address of server
port - Port number to be used (if null, the 6667 is used)
channels - Vararg of channels to join

removeServer

@Transactional
public void removeServer(String address)
Deletes a server by address name, removing from database. This will NOT disconnect the associated bot. Warning: If you have multiple bots on one server this will delete all of them.

Parameters:
address - The address of the server to be deleted

sendGlobalMessage

public void sendGlobalMessage(String msg)
Send a message to every channel on every server Quackbot is connected to. Use carefully!

Parameters:
msg - Message to send
